course.terrain_type: Seasonal two-track roads with sand, mud, and rocks
course.terrain_surface: Sager Road isn't gravel—it's an unmaintained seasonal two-track with sand ruts, mud holes, and baby-head rocks
course.signature_challenge: The weather. April Michigan weather spans 20°F to 81°F. You're gambling on conditions you can't know until race morning.
course.character: Punchy, technical, unpredictable. Michigan doesn't do sustained climbs—it does 50+ rollers that hit you constantly. Sager Road defines the race's character.
key_features: Sager Road signature section (mile 18 on 36-mile, mile 60 on 100-mile)
Two unavoidable mud puddles on 100-mile at mile 60

suffering_zones.label: Three Sisters
suffering_zones.desc: Three consecutive punchy climbs immediately after leaving pavement. Primary selection point. If you're not with the lead group here, you won't bridge.
suffering_zones.terrain_detail: First real test of the day

suffering_zones.label: Sager Road
suffering_zones.desc: Unmaintained seasonal two-track with sand ruts, mud holes, and baby-head rocks. This is the signature section that defines Barry-Roubaix.
suffering_zones.terrain_detail: 100-mile version adds 'Big Papa' with more sand, more climbing, and two unavoidable mud puddles

suffering_zones.label: The Wall
suffering_zones.desc: 0.2-mile climb averaging 11% with a false summit and a 'fun little final pitch.' Many athletes walk portions.
suffering_zones.terrain_detail: Comes late enough to expose fatigue but early enough to not be the final climb

course.climate_description: Historical race temps range from 20°F to 81°F—a 61-degree swing. In bad years (2017, 2022), DNF rates hit 40%+. In good years, course records fall.
climate_challenges: Weather unpredictability is THE defining feature
Equipment strategy must account for all scenarios

biased_opinion.summary: Barry-Roubaix is the world's largest gravel race for a reason. It's professionally run, technically challenging, and completely unpredictable. The weather roulette makes every year different. The community ownership makes it feel like home. The value proposition is unmatched in American gravel.

logistics.parking: Available near start line. Arrive early for best spots.
logistics.registration: Opens November 15 annually. Sells out in 24 hours. Cost: $79-119 depending on distance
